movement
Class Driver

java.lang.Object
  java.lang.Thread
      movement.Driver
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Runnable
public final class Driver
extends java.lang.Thread

Driver class that has the control of motor, not open to extension because we do not want two instance of this running at the same time.

Version:
1.9
Author:
yuechuan

travelTo

public void travelTo(Coordinate nextLocation)
travel to wrt to the global (0,0) coordinate . Since this method use currentCoordinate which is \ initialized during object initialization. this method is made an instance method to avoid undefined behavior.

Parameters:
nextLocationg -

forward

public void forward(double dist)
move wheel forward at the same speed it was running at before

Parameters:
dist -

backward

public void backward(double dist)
move wheel backward at the same speed it was running at before. The motor will always move a tinny bit more than the defined distance due to the implementation. the extra amount depends on how fast can CPU process can run the while loop, the highest pulling interval should be more than 20 ms, which is the time I have set arbitrarily.

Parameters:
dist -

rotateToRelatively

public void rotateToRelatively(double degree)
rotate to the angle wrt to the current robot angle. the method will only finish after rotating is over.
this method is here only for comparability.
use rotateToRelatively (double degree , boolean returnRightAway); when ever possible

Parameters:
degree -

rotateToRelatively

public void rotateToRelatively(double degree,
                               boolean returnRightAway)
rotate to the angle wrt to the current robot angle. the method will only finish after rotating is over.

Parameters:
degree -
returnRightAway - should the function finish before finishing the turn

motorForward

public void motorForward()
set motor to go forward till motorStop() or flt() All actions involving forwarding the motor must call this method

motorBackward

public void motorBackward()

isMotorStopped

public static boolean isMotorStopped()
check if motor is stopped

Returns:
true if the motor is in a non action state

motorStop

public void motorStop()
stop motor All actions involving stopping the motor must call this method
